intro: Epithema involucratum, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to regions of Central and South America. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its botanical features make it adaptable to a variety of soil types and climates, contributing to its invasive potential in some areas.
